metadata.feature_description: Shows template status indicators like Hidden, Disabled, or Published

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Templates List Loads and Displays Status Information

steps.action: Login as SuperUser and navigate to Manage > Templates
steps.expected: Templates section should load with a list of available templates
steps.actual: Templates section loaded successfully showing 5 templates with thumbnails and names

steps.action: View the templates list to verify template information display
steps.expected: Templates should display with name, thumbnail, and status indicators where applicable
steps.actual: Templates displayed with names and thumbnails. All templates appear to be in Published (Visible) status as no Hidden/Disabled status indicators are visible

steps.action: Click on a template to select it and view additional details
steps.expected: Selected template should show preview and edit options
steps.actual: Cavalier - Main template was selected (highlighted in blue), showing a large preview of the template page layout with Edit button available

steps.action: Verify all templates are displayed with their current status
steps.expected: Templates should show status indicators for Hidden or Disabled templates
steps.actual: All 5 templates are displayed: Cavalier - Main, Test Template Page, Workflow Test Template, Test Special Characters, Test Settings Template. No Hidden/Disabled status indicators visible (all templates are in Published/Visible status)

observations: Code analysis confirms status display mechanism is implemented via CSS class binding: status span has 'visibility: hidden' by default and becomes visible only when status is 'Hidden' or 'Disabled'
The GetTabStatus() method in PageManagementController.cs determines status: 'Disabled' when tab.DisableLink is true, 'Hidden' when tab.IsVisible is false, 'Visible' otherwise
All existing templates in the test environment are in 'Visible/Published' status, so no Hidden/Disabled status indicators were displayed during testing
To fully verify Hidden/Disabled status display, templates with those statuses would need to be created or existing templates modified, which is beyond the scope of this smoke test
